description: This externship, co-convened by a senior policymaker and a law professor, is designed to enable the student to gain a better understanding of influence of the law in the arts and adjacent sectors, inter alia, literary, visual and performing arts, in particular intellectual property and contract laws. The student will be involved in the Arts Resource Hub, draft artistsâ€™ rights statements and agreement templates for arts practitioners, and perform high-quality research relevant for policymakers.
